original_question: What type of pollutants enter the air directly?
diverse_qns: Can you tell me about the kinds of pollutants that go straight into the air?
Could you identify what forms of pollutants are directly released into the atmosphere?
What categories of pollutants are immediately emitted into the air?

pred_ans: Directly entering air pollutants include particulate matter, sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides, carbon monoxide, and volatile organic compounds.
pred_ans_conf_NL_MCQ: Particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, sulfur dioxide, carbon monoxide, and volatile organic compounds
pred_ans_conf_OE: The main pollutants that enter the air directly are particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, sulfur dioxide, and volatile organic compounds.
pred_diverse_ans: Yes, particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, sulfur dioxide, and volatile organic compounds are some of the pollutants that go straight into the air.

Yes, there are various forms of pollutants that are directly released into the atmosphere, including particulate matter, sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides, volatile organic compounds, and carbon monoxide.
Immediately emitted pollutants into the air include particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, sulfur dioxide, carbon monoxide, and volatile organic compounds.
The types of pollutants that enter the air without intermediaries in pollution are known as primary pollutants.
Directly discharged contaminants into the air include particulate matter, sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides, volatile organic compounds, and carbon monoxide.
The various types of pollutants that directly find their way into the atmosphere include particulate matter, sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides, volatile organic compounds, carbon monoxide, and mercury.
Yes, some common pollutants that go directly into the air include particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, sulfur dioxide, carbon monoxide, and volatile organic compounds.
Directly introduced pollutants into the air include particulate matter, sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides, carbon monoxide, and volatile organic compounds.
Immediately put into the air are pollutants such as particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, sulfur dioxide, carbon monoxide, and volatile organic compounds.
The different types of pollutants that are directly released into the air include particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, sulfur dioxide, carbon monoxide, volatile organic compounds, and mercury.
